449
December 21st 3
Brig Genl Lorenzo Thomas
Adjutant General U. S. A.
Washington City
General --
In compliance with the resulition of the General Assembly of Ky, his Excellency Gov Bramlette, has directed one to place before the Federal Authorities the following:

The records of this office show that Kentucky has placed in the field 37,636 men for three years -- 13,679 men for one year and 3737 men for shorter periods -- making a total of 55,052 -- accompanying herewith are schedules marked A. B. C. D. E. F. showing the exact number of men furnished for the various periods, with a recapitulation of same. For peculiar reasons Kentucky was authorized to raise men for one years service by Special act of Congress, to the number of 20,000 -- under this authority near 10,000 have been already recruited -- the exact number
450
cannot be given as it is daily increasing -- more than two thirds of whom have been already mustered into the U. S. service -- one regiment of heavy artillery is being recruited -- and recruiting for the is progressing.
As will be seen by the accompanying resolutions of the General Assembly -- it is to correct the disparity between ours and obtain the exact credit to which we think ourselves entitled.

The calls for troops by the General Government of 1861 and 1862, we understand was based on the census of 1860 -- From the population of Kentucky capable of bearing arms -- in the beginning of the War. There should be deducted 17000 men -- the number supplied from the best data at command, to have originally joined the rebel armies -- this is above one eighth of our militia and is the number which calculations by reliable authorities have assumed to have so .

In obedience to the above named resolution, and the direction of the Govr, I have the honor to submit the following in your consideration and answer --
451

1st That the quotas of Kentucky for 1861 & 1862 be so far modified as to allow for the for the fighting population -- the assurance by the General Government in assigning such quotas of 17000 men or more than one eighth of our militia who fled beyond the jurisdiction of the state --
2nd That you be kind enough to communicate the number of men so consisted, if possible, required from Ky, under the call up to this date --

3rd That if customary with other states, you communicate the ratio of the relative value of the various terms of service -- That is how many men for the various short terms of service against as equivalent for one three years man, and if such value is determined, the compliment of Kentucky to the of three year service

4th That you be kind enough to suggest some plans by which the rolls of the War Department, and your own, may be made to -- and the large discrepancy exisiting between them be rectified -- In this correction, it may be stated that the disparity of numbers may be considerably , if those who are mustered into state service, and
452
some disabled by Wounds or are Killed before their commands are received by the U. S. service be credited to the State or certified from this office.

Your early attention is especially desired to the foregoing questions, which it is , within your answering communication will satisfy fully the object of the resolutions, of the General Assembly -- In her loyalty and patriotism Kentucky faces, without distrust that was and is mentioned require only to be to meet correction by the War Department --

Respectfully
Your obd't servnt
John Boyle
Adj Gen of Ky
